reviews.review_msg: overall good prof. marking was a little slow and not by her own fault the TAs were pretty useless. exams were hard but pretty fair. good OH, solid lectures, and pretty good assignments.

Jocelyn Minns was the last second substitute for CMPT 225 and taught the course for the first time when I had her. She made very clear powerpoints and her lectures were absolute amazing. She would go in depth on some practice problems which really helped. Exams were very fair and grading wasn't too tough. By far my favourite CS prof.

Jocelynn was a pleasure to have as a prof. She went out of her way to help me with tough concepts, walk through dense code and nail down concepts, often outside of normal office hours, never making me feel like my questions were stupid even when they probably were. HIGHLY recommend!

I am not sure if Jocelyn has a permanent position at SFU but I really hope she is given one. You can tell she cares about students and is passionate about teaching as she gives students manageable expectations about assignments and exams. I hope to see more new professors like her in the comp sci department who actually want to see students succeed

She's an awesome prof, explains things really well and makes the material easy to follow. Her assignments and exams are fair, and she gives practice questions to help you prepare. If you're taking CMPT 307, I'd definitely recommend.

Good professor, Assignments not heavy straight from textbook. Her lectures come from the textbook straight up when studying I would recommend just reading the textbook. Exams were not insanely difficult. She learns and changed up the exams based on how the class did. Overall recommend.

Very good professor! All assignments, midterms, and the final exam were very reasonable. Nothing tricky or unexpected. They simply tested fundamental skills that were taught in class + textbook readings.The assignments were not hard and served as reinforcement of what was taught in class and useful preparation for the exams. Best prof for 307 :D

Nice prof!! She follows the textbook closely.. she explains all the code by actually running through it ensuring everything is understood well.. also tries to make the class engaging.. also she pretty much covers all the chapters needed for data structures which is really helpful for interview prep.. fair exams as well and responds to emails asap..

Fair exams. Gives practise questions before midterm and final. Assignments also not bad, she gives plenty of time and helps with any questions in her office hours or after class. Would definitely recommend!

She has to be the best prof for the course. Assignments and exams are fair. She is also very helpful outside class and replies to any concerns instantly. It was her first time teaching the course but she did an amazing job. Better than all the other 307 profs at SFU for sure... If you see a course is taught by her, take it, you will learn a lot.
Easy assignments and exams. She gives good teaching lectures, but reading the textbook for better understanding is good. Def recommand

She is a gem.. Best prof for the course. Fair assignments, fair exams. And excellent lectures. Always available to help. By far she is the best professor I have ever hadâ€¦  307 is known be one of the hardest CS course, she made it enjoyable as well..

Very nice prof. The assignments/exams were really easy (wasn't any [pseudo]code on final at all). This is good but also bad since I feel underprepared for interviews - what I hoped this course would help on. Lecture slides were taken from the textbook, making code hard to follow, but she tried her best to explain. Lots of repeat CMPT 225 concepts.

Amazing lectures, clear examples, posts slides for each lecture on canvas, posts good practice stuff for midterms and finals and a nice % of your grade is padded by chill assignments as well. Formula sheet allowed as well for exams overall a top 5 cs prof i've had (Toby, Bobby level)
